title: How to Make Raspberry Cranachan

text: Making Raspberry Cranachan Place the raspberries in a bowl. Pour the Framboise liquor over the raspberries and leave them on the side for 2 hours at room temperature. Spread the oatmeal on an oven tray or oven proof dish. Bake the oatmeal for 6 minutes at 180 °F (82 °C). You'll see that the oatmeal will become slightly dark in color and give off a warm & roasted aroma when it's done. Whip the cream in a bowl until it thickens.  Get a separate bowl for the mascarpone cheese. Measure and pour half of the whiskey into the cheese bowl and whip them together. Pour in the honey and continue whipping. Add in the other half of the whiskey and stir. Add and fold the whipping cream in. Mix thoroughly until you get a smooth consistency. Place in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to spoon about 5 or 6 raspberries into a serving glass, while draining out the liquor. Spoon over a little of the cream mixture to completely cover the raspberries. Continue alternating layers until each glass is full. Garnish each glass with roasted oatmeal and icing sugar.  Finished.  Make Traditional Cranachan Toast the oats. Over a medium heat, toast the porridge oats in a frying pan for about four minutes. Don't let them burn. Put aside to cool. Whip the cream lightly. The cream should form soft peaks. Fold in the toasted oats and the raspberries. Leave aside a few for garnishing. Add the honey and whisky. Fold these in gently to not knock the air out of the whipped cream. Spoon the traditional Cranachan into four individual serving dishes or glasses. Garnish with mint and raspberries.
